summary: TRUCK HAS A DIESEL ENGINE WITH A DEFECTIVE INJECTOR PUMP. ENGINE WILL SHUT OFF WITH OUT NOTICE, NO INDICATION, JUST INSTANTLY SHUTS OFF COMPLETELY WHILE DRIVING. I HAVE HAD TO REPLACE A TOTAL OF 5 OR 6 INJECTOR PUMPS SINCE PURCHASING THIS VEHICLE NEW. THE LAST OCCURRENCE WAS MARCH 2014.  *TR
1997 CHEVROLET 3500. WRANGLER HT TIRES (LT245/75R16) WERE DRY ROTTED.   *NJ  THE CONSUMER STATED THE TIRES DID NOT HAVE ANY TREAD LEFT. *JB

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1997 CHEVROLET C3500.  THE CONTACT STATED     THAT THE WINDSHIELD WIPERS WORKED INTERMITTENTLY OR NOT AT ALL ON LOW SPEEDS.  AS OF DECEMBER 11, 2007, THE DEALER HAD NOT INSPECTED THE VEHICLE.  THE DEALER STATED THAT HIS VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 03V159000 (VISIBILITY: WINDSHIELD WIPER/WASHER).  THE CONTACT FELT THAT HIS VEHICLE SHOULD BE INCLUDED IN THE RECALL.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 150,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 205,000.      UPDATED 03-04-08 *BF
FAILURE OF ABS SYSTEM IN 1997 CHEVROLET PICKUP CK3500.*JB
COMPLAINT IS FOR A TIRE PLY FAILURE ON A FIRESTONE FIREHAWK RMT TIRE SIZE LT235/85-R16

DT:  CONTACT STATES THAT THERE WAS A PREVIOUS RECALL ON HIS VEHICLE, AND THE DEALERSHIP TOLD HIM THAT THE RECALL DID NOT INCLUDE HIS VEHICLE.  THEN HE CALLED THE MANUFACTURER, THEY TOLD HIM HIS VEHICLE DID QUALIFY BUT HIS VEHICLE HAD MORE THAN 70000 MILES, AND THEY WOULDN'T REPLACE IT. THE NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 03V159000. THE CONTACT IS HAVING THE SAME PROBLEM WITH HIS VEHICLE AS THIS RECALL STATES:   ON CERTAIN MINIVANS, PICKUP TRUCKS, AND SPORT UTILITY VEHICLES WITH CERTAIN MODEL-ENGINE COMBINATIONS, THE WINDSHIELD WIPER MOTOR MAY FAIL DUE TO CRACKED SOLDER JOINTS ON THE CONTROLLER CIRCUIT BOARD. THE WINDSHIELD WIPERS COULD WORK INTERMITTENTLY OR NOT AT ALL.   THE CONTACT HAD THE PART REPLACED TODAY.   *AK   THIS FAILURE OCCURRED ON NUMEROUS OCCASIONS.  SOMETIMES THE WIPERS WOULD ONLY WORK ON HIGH SPEED.   *SC

I HAVE A 1997 CHEVY 3500 4X4 PICKUP TRUCK. EVER SINCE I BOUGHT IT I HAVE HAD PROBLEMS WITH THE ANTILOCK BRAKES. THEY SEEM TO COME ON AT SLOW SPEEDS UNEXPECTEDLY. I HAD THEM REPLACED 1 TIME AT A COST OF $700, HOWEVER WITHIN 3 MONTHS THE PROBLEM RECUERRED. I CANNOT AFFORD TO KEEP REPAIRING THEM AS UPON TALKING TO OTHER OWNERS OF THE SAME TYPE OF VEHICLES BY GM THIS IS A COMMON PROBLEM THE SOLUTION TO WHICH IS TO REMOVE THE ABS FUSE RENDERING THE SYSTEM INOPERATIVE. I UNDERSTAND THERE IS AN INVESTIGATION ABOUT THIS PROBLEM FOR YEARS 1999-2001. WHAT I WANT YOU TO KNOW IS THAT IS ALSO COMMON TO VEHICLES MADE BEFORE 1999. THERE MAY NOT BE MAY COMPLAINTS BECAUSE MOST PEOPLE PULL THE FUSE AND DISABLE THE ABS SYSTEM.

WHILE DRIVING AND UPON MAKING A STOP THE BRAKE PEDAL WENT COMPLETELY TO THE FLOOR. VEHICLE THEN SURGED FORWARD. IT FELT AS IF SOMETHING DISENGAGED, AND THE PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR. CONSUMER HAD TO USE THE EMERGENCY BRAKE TO STOP THE VEHICLE. CONSUMER FOUND THAT A CLIP BROKE WHICH LEFT THE BRAKE PEDAL SWINGING. *AK  THE CLIP WHICH HOLDS THE MASTER CYLINDER ROD TO THE BRAKE PEDAL BROKE ALLOWING THE ROD TO SLIP OFF.  *NM
DRIVING ON INTERSTATE WHILE RAINING.  WINDSHIELD WIPER FAILURE, COULD NOT SEE, HAD TO STOP AND WAIT FOR RAIN TO STOP.  TOOK VEHICLE TO DEALER TO FIX.

I LOST MY POWER STEERING AND BRAKES ON MY 3500 CHEVY. 1997 PICK UP TRUCK, THERE IS ONLY 56.000 MILES ON THIS TRUCK.   I HAD THE TRUCK TOWED IN AND HAD THE POWER STEERING PUMP REPLACED AT MY COST, I CALLED THE CHEY. FACTORY AND THE GIRL SAID THEY HAVEN'T HAD A PROBLEM WITH THE PUMPS. ALL I KNOW IS I'M GLAD I WASN'T TRAVELING AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS AS YOU CAN'T CONTROLL THE STEERING OR THE BRAKING ON THIS TRUCK.

IN AN EMERGENCY OR PANIC STOP ABS BRAKE SYSTEM MALFUNCTIONED.  ONCE CONSUMER APPLIED THE BRAKES  THERE WAS 3 OR 4 SECONDS OF NO BRAKING POWER. *AK    AS A RESULT, CONSUMER REAR ENDED ANOTHER VEHICLE.  MANUFACTURER SAID THAT IT WAS A NORMAL BEHAVIOR OF THE VEHICLE AND WAS PERFORMING BY DESIGN.  *LA

WHEN TRYING TO STOP  VEHICLE  BY APPLYING THE BRAKES BRAKE PEDAL WENT ALL THE WAY TO THE FLOOR, RESULTING IN BRAKE FAILURE.   ALSO,  POWER STEERING  FAILED WHEN TRYING TO TURN LEFT.   INDEPENDENT MECHANIC REPLACED THE POWER STEERING PUMP, AND MADE SOME REPAIRS TO THE BRAKING SYSTEM.  HOWEVER, BRAKES STILL OPERATED POORLY. *AK

STEERING PROBLEMS.  SINCE MY TRUCK WAS NEW I HAVE HAD PROBLEMS WITH THE POWER STEERING.  I HAVE INTERMITTENT LOSS OF POWER STEERING, PARTICULARLY WHEN GOING AT LOW SPEED.  SOMETIMES THERE IS ALSO UNINTENDED POWER ASSIST THAT PULLS THE CAR IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION. I HAVE COMPLAINED ABOUT IT A DEALER AND BEEN TOLD THERE IS NOTHING WRONG. I HAVE HAD IT CHECKED BY A GM DEALER AND BEEN TOLD THERE IS NOTHING WRONG. BUT THE PROBLEM PERSISTS. SOMETIMES, WHEN I PULL INTO MY DRIVEWAY, WHICH IS USUALLY A LEFT HAND TURN, I TOTALLY LOSE THE POWER STEERING.   I HAVE ALSO HAD REPEATED FAILURE OF THE CLUTCH SYSTEM AND SLAVE CYLINDER.  I HAVE COMPLAINED OVER AND OVER AGAIN TO GM WITH NO RESULTS.  I HAVE HAD TO REPLACE THE CLUTCH THREE TIMES.  AT ONE POINT, IT SHOT ME FORWARD OUT OF MY DRIVEWAY INTO THE TRAFFIC UNEXPECTEDLY WHEN I PUSHED IN THE CLUTCH.  I BELIEVE IT IS A DANGER.  IT HAS BEEN GIVING ME TROUBLE SINCE THE TRUCK HAD 30,000 MILES ON IT. I HAVE BEEN TOLD BY TWO MECHANICS THAT IT IS DEFECTIVE. GM WILL DO NOTHING AND HAS DONE NOTHING SINCE THE FIRST COMPLAINT AT 30,000 MILES.

WE HAVE A 1997 CHEV ONE TON TRUCK WITH 6 TIRES.  WE CHECKED OUR TIRES YESTERDAY AND FOUND THEM TO HAVE CRACKS IN SEVERAL OF THE SIDE WALLS AND ONE EVEN SEEMED TO BE STARTING A BUBBLE.  THESE TIRES HAVE BEEN MAINTAINED BY AIR PRESSURE CHECKED AND ROTATED.  THERE IS ABOUT 27,000 MILES ON THESE TIRES LT225/75/R16

CONSUMER CALLED COMPLAINING ABOUT THE GAS TANK. VEHICLE ONLY HAS 84000 MILES. FUEL TANK SPLIT BETWEEN TWO TO THREE INCHES IN BETWEEN THE TANK. MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED, AND STATED THAT THERE WAS A RECALL ON 1998 MODEL, BUT CONSUMER NEVER RECEIVED  A RECALL LETTER, AND  MANUFACTURER WILL NOT REIMBURSE THE MONEY.DEALER WAS NOT CONTACTED, VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED AT AN INDEPENDENT SHOP.*AK
WHILE DRIVING THE TRANSMISSION LOCKED UP.  *NLM

THE PROBLEM OCCURS BECAUSE THE DIESEL FILLER CAP IS NOT LABELED NOR IS THE FILLER DOOR NOR DOES THE MANUAL CONTAIN ANY NOTICE. THE CAP ON A 1997 VEHICLE (NON-DIESEL FITS ON A DIESEL) ONE IS APPARAENTLY VENTED ONE IS NOT. BUT THERE IS NOT WAY TO AS CERTAIN WHICH IS VENTED IN WHICH IS NOT. THE AFTERMARKET DEALERS DO NOT SHOW A DISTINCTION. APPARENTLY, THE CAP I PLACED ON THE VEHICLE WAS NOT VENTED AND RESULTED IN THE TANK IMPLODING TO THE POINT THAT THE INTAKE TUBE AND SENSOR WERE BENT WITHIN 6 INCHES IF THE TOP OF THE TANK. THE TANK WAS FLATTENED. GM NEEDS TO MARK THESE FILLER CAPS.  DT

CONSUMER STATES THE THE DISTRIBUTOR GEAR TEETH BROKE, CAUSING THE ENGINE TO SHUT OFF WHILE THE CONSUMER WAS STILL DRIVING, WHICH ALMOST CAUSED LOSS OF CONTROL.  NLM    THE GEAR TEETH BROKE BECAUSE OF EXCESSIVE WEAR ON THE TEETH OF THE DISTRIBUTOR GEAR.  THE DISTRIBUTOR SHAFT IS SLIGHTLY BENT.  *JG
CONSUMER DOES NOT LIST DEFECT.
PE00 020; CONSUMER WAS TRAVELING ABOUT 72MPH ON  HIGHWAY AND HEARD A NOISE. HE WAS ABLE TO PULL OVER, AND SAW THAT  DRIVER'S SIDE LEFT FRONT  TREAD SEPARATED.  GENERAL TIRES,  P235/7016 .  *AK

THE TWO CENTER CROSS MEMBERS WHICH HOLD THE FUEL TANK HAD CRACKS, ONE CRACKED COMPLETELY THROUGH AND THE SECOND WAS CRACKED 3/4'S THROUGH THE METAL, THE FUEL TANK ALMOST TOUCHED THE GROUND,  THE CROSS MEMBERS WERE REPLACED.   *CJ

DRIVING 60MPH HEARD A LOUD POP. PULLED OVER & SAW THE LEFT REAR TIRE HAD LOST ALL  TREAD.  TREAD HAD HIT  VEHICLE & BENT  FENDER. PART OF TREAD WAS STILL ON TIRE WHICH HAD DEFLATED. PLACED SPARE ON. TOOK VEHICLE TO TIRE RETAILER & HAD IT REPLACED.  OTHER 3 TIRES WERE OKAY. 1997, CHEVROLET 3500(REPLACEMENT) WITH 13,000 MILES. FIRESTONE, STEEL TEX, R4S LT 265/75R16, DOT VNW81XM278.  *AK   *SLC

WINDSHIELD WIPER MOTOR SEEMS TO BE DEFECTIVE. SOMETIMES IT WILL WORK AND OTHER TIMES IT WILL NOT, RESULTING IN A VERY POTENTIAL HAZARD WHEN DRIVING. KNOW OF 2 OTHER PEOPLE WHO HAVE 1993-1997 GMC C/K PICK-UPS WHO HAVE HAD THEIR WIPER MOTORS REPLACED DUE TO THIS IDENTICAL DEFECT.*AK
WHEN HITTING A RAISED SECTION ON  ROAD AND APPLYING BRAKES,  VEHICLE WILL TAKE AT LEAST AN EXTRA 5 FEET BEFORE IT  WILL STOP. CONSUMER MUST APPLY BRAKES EXTREMELY HARD.*AK
FUEL PUMP MALFUNCTIONED WHILE DRIVING, CAUSING  VEHICLE TO COMPLETELY SHUT DOWN. DEALER REPLACED  FUEL PUMP,  WHICH DID NOT CORRECT THE PROBLEM. PLEASE GIVE ANY FURTHER DETAILS.*AK

BRAKES PULL TO THE RIGHT WHEN APPLIED TO THE POINT OF CAUSING A LANE CHANGE OR DRIFTING INTO SHOULDER. WORSE WHEN TOWING A 8000LB FIFTH. RIGHT ROTOR OVERHEATS AND WARPS. SERVICE MANAGER CLAIMS THIS IS A COMMON PROBLEM AND CANNOT BE REPAIRED. MECHANICS REP
CONSUMER HAS PROBLEM WITH  ENGINE.  THERE WAS OIL LEAKING FROM UNDERNEATH AND  VEHICLE  LOST  POWER.  BLACK SMOKE WAS COMING FROM UNDERNEATH THE PIPE.  *AK

VEHICLE ALWAYS PULLS TO THE LEFT WHEN BRAKING..SO HARD TO AS PULL YOU INTO ONCOMMING TRAFFIC..THE ROTORS/PADS AND THE CALIPERS HAVE BEEN REPLACED.SEVERAL TIMES.THE ROTORS ONCE, CALIPERS TWICE, AND THE PADS 6 TIMES..OK FOR ABOUT 50 MILES THEN STARTS THE SAME ALL OVER.  *AK

WHILE MAKING RIGHT HAND CURVE  STEERING WILL LOCK UP FOR A SECOND.  THEN,  LOOSEN UP AND  GO OUT OF CONTROL.  TOOK VEHICLE IN TO HAVE  IT SERVICED. WAS TOLD  THAT THERE WERE  OTHER  COMPLAINTS ABOUT THE SAME PROBLEM, AND GMC IS LOOKING INTO IT. *AK
REAR AXLE SEALS CONTINUALLY LEAK OIL CAUSING DAMAGE TO BRAKES, EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCES PRIOR TO REPLACEMENTS.  *MJS
WHEN APPLYING  ABS BRAKES ON WET PAVEMENT  FRONT WHEELS GRABBED AND LET GO, AND  REAR WHEELS CONTINUED  TO ROLL,  CAUSING EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE. DEALER COULD NOT DUPILCATE THE PROBLEM. *AK
UNDER NORMAL DRIVING BRAKES PULL TO THE RIGHT WHEN THEY ARE APPLIED.  CONTACTED DEALER AND MANUFACTURER. THEY HAD PADS  AND BRAKES REPLACED  THREE TIMES.  VEHICLE  IS IN THE SHOP RIGHT NOW.  *AK
REPAIRS DONE AT LOCAL DEALER -ALLEN SAMUELS CHEV. IN WACO & TRUCK HAS BEEN REPORTED TO LEMON LAW-COURT DATE DEC 7, 1999. NO SAFETY DEFECT (S) LISTED IN SUMMARY.  *AK

WHEN TRAVELING ON ROUGH ROAD SURFACE & UPON DEPRESSING THE BRAKE PEDAL TO MAKE A NORMAL STOP,  BRAKES AUTOMATICALLY  RELEASE, CAUSING POOR BRAKING ABILITY. CONSUMER HAS CONTACTED THE DEALER. PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER DETAILS.  *AK
ROTORS AND BRAKES HAVE BEEN WARPING, BOTH HAVE BEEN REPLACED 3 TIMES  WITHIN 4200 MILES ON VEHICLE.  *AK

components: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC,FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE,POWER TRAIN,TIRES
summary: NO SUMMARY( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: 225/75/16 )
ANOTHER DEALER HAS CORRECTED THE PROBLEMS, BUT I THOUGHT I'D REPORT THESE SERIOUS SAFETY CONCERNS. NO SAFETY DEFECT MENTIONED IN THE SUMMARY.  *AK
WHEN DRIVING AT ANY SPEED  VEHICLE  STALLS AND THERE IS NO POWER, VEHICLE KEEPS CUTTING OFF.  *AK
CLUTCH THROW OUT BEARING WENT OUT, CAUSING PIECES OF IT TO GO INTO CLUTCH AND JAMMING GEAR SHIFT. AT THE TIME, DRIVER WAS IN 5TH GEAR AND COULD NOT CHANGE GEARS, WHICH ALMOST CAUSED AN COLLISION. *AK

WHILE COMING OFF A RAMP TO AN INTERSECTION AT ABOUT 60 MPH, WENT TO PUT ON BRAKES AND BACK WHEELS BOUNCED. PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR AND CAME RIGHT BACK. CONSUMER  WAS STOPPED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE INTERSECTION.  *AK
WINDSHIELD WIPERS INTERMITTENTLY STOP DURING PERFORMANCE. DEALER REPLACED THE WIPER MODULE.  *AK

WHENEVER ABS BRAKES ARE APPLIED, WOULD BECOME SPORADIC & NOT FUNCTION PROPERLY. WHEN WEATHER IS RAINY & COMING TO A STOP, ABS BRAKES WOULD LOCK UP. VEHICLE WOULD SLIDE SOME DISTANCE. TOOK TO DEALER & MECHANIC COULD NOT FIND CAUSE OF PROBLEM.  *AK
INTERMITTNETLY WHEN THE BRAKES ARE APPLIED IN A PANIC STOP THE PEDAL GOES TO THE FLOOR, RESULTING IN EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE.  THE DEALER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK
BRAKE PADS ARE RUNNING TOO CLOSE TO  BRAKE DISCS.  THE DEALER HAS REPLACED THE BRAKE PADS SEVERAL TIMES.   MANUFACTURER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK
WINDSHIELD WIPERS WORK INTERMITTENTLY .  THE DEALER AND MANUFACTURER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK
DEFECTIVE GEAR BOX IS CAUSING STEERING TO BECOME LOOSE. IN ADDITION, BRAKE FLUID IS LEAKING, CAUSING A LOSS OF BRAKES/ TIRES WORE OUT IN A SHORT DURATION OF TIME.  *AK
SPARK PLUG FAILED.  *YC

HAD STARTED VEHICLE. THE ENGINE WOULD START TO SHAKE & MAKE LOUD KNOCKING NOISES. TOOK VEHICLE TO DEALER 7 INFORMED NOTHING COULD BE DONE. WAS TOLD TO CALL BBB. WOULD NOT CHECK OR REPAIR ENGINE PROBLEM.  *AK
CONSUMER EXPERIENCING ONGOING PROBLEM WITH FRONT BRAKING PADS AND ROTORS REPLACED.  DEALER NOTIFIED.  *AK

11-8-98 INCIDENT, DEALER STILL UNABLE TO DETERMINE CAUSE FOR BRAKE FAILURE.  DEALER DROVE TRUCK AROUND BUILDING TO SHOP, HAD BRAKES.  DEALER DROVE TRUCK INTO SHOP FOR REPAIR AND HAD NO BRAKES. SAMEDAY, SAME HOUR.

components: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE,ELECTRICAL SYSTEM
summary: WHILE DRIVING THE VEHICLE SHUTS DOWN AND DIES, GIVING THE DRIVER NO INDICATION.  THE DEALER HAS CHANGED THE FUEL PUMP AND THE IGNITION PUMP  , HOWEVER , DEALER HAS NOT BEEN ABLE TO DUPLICATE THE PROBLEM.  THE MANUFACTURER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK
WHILE DRIVING THE VEHICLE STALLED UNEXPECTEDLY WHICH CAUSED AN ACCIDENT.  CAUSE UNKNOWN.  DEALER CANNOT DETERMINE PROBLEM.  PLEASE PROVIDE DETAILS.  *AK

WHILE DRIVING THE VEHICLE AT 25 MPH AND UPON  APPLYING FORCE TO THE BRAKE PEDAL TO MAKE A NORMAL STOP, THE PEDAL TRAVELED TO THE FLOORBOARD, CAUSING EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE WHICH RESULTED IN A COLLISION. CONSUMER HAS CONTACTED THE DEALER, DEALER UNABLE TO DETERMINE THE CAUSE OF THE PROBLEM.   *AK
WHEN APPLYING THE ABS BRAKES THE PEDAL TRAVELS TO THE FLOOR, CAUSING EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE. CAUSE UNKNOWN.  PLEASE GIVE ANY FURTHER DETAILS.  *AK

THE DEFECTIVE BRAKING SYSTEM MALFUNCTIONED, CAUSING A NOISE WHEN BRAKING AND EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE, WHICH ALMOST CAUSED AN ACCIDENT.  BEEN TO DLR 4 TIMES.  DEALER CANNOT DETERMINE PROBLEM.    *AK
RIVETS TO THE UPPER BALL JOINTS SNAPPED OFF, CAUSING RIGHT WHEEL TO BLOW OUT.
RIVETS HOLDING THE BALL JOINT TO THE UPPER CONTROL ARM SNAPPED.

WHEN STEPPING ON THE BRAKE PEDAL TO STOP, BRAKES FAILED TWICE, ONCE RESULTING IN A COLLISION. THE BRAKE PEDAL FELT SOFT AND WENT TO THE FLOOR. ALSO, BRAKE FLUID LEAKED OUT OF THE TRUCK. HAS HAD THE BRAKES REPAIRED TWICE.  *AK
FRONT STRAP THAT HOLDS THE GAS TANK TO THE VEHICLE BROKE, ONLY REAR STRAP WAS HOLDING TANK TO THE VEHICLE.
RECEIVED RECALL NOTICE FOR VEHICLE . TAKEN TO DEALER AND WORK WAS REFUSED. RECALL MAN #C97008-5.   *AK
EXPERIENCED FIRE IN DASH AND UNDER HOOD, TOTAL LOSS.   *AK
